browser-action.name: evaluatejavascript
browser-action.description:
Executes some arbitrary Javascript code in the current page context
Possible parameters are: - script (required): A javascript function or expression to execute - variableName (optional): The name of the variable where the evaluation result will be stored. - frameIndex (optional): Frame index. Takes priority over frameName parameter. - frameName (optional): Frame name. - waitForNavigation.url (optional): URL pattern targeted, ex:http://tricentis.com/.* . The URL being navigated to must match this pattern. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. - waitForNavigation.timeout (optional): If applicable, the navigation must occur within the specified timeout in ms. By default the OpenBrowser defaultNavigationTimeout is used. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed. - waitForNavigation.until (optional): Allowed values are : LOAD, DOMCONTENTLOADED, NETWORKIDLE, COMMIT. Default value is LOAD. The navigation will be considered done when the specified state is reached. Enables a wait for page navigation after this action has been executed.
